explanation: Agent A is correct. The for statement is not well-formed under MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.2: the third clause is off += (size_t) len which uses the object len that is assigned inside the loop body (len = read(...)). Rule 14.2(3) requires the third clause to modify only the loop counter and not use objects that are modified in the loop body. Although the third clause only modifies off, it reads len which is modified by the body, so this violates the rule. A compliant fix is to move the off update into the loop body (or convert the loop to a while loop) so the third clause does not depend on an object modified by the body.
